text: J'adore les pâtes et quand j'ai vu que ce nouveau restaurant offrait des plats à bon prix , je n'ai pas hésité à essayer! Je ne sais pas si c'est parce que c'est nouveau, mais pour le moment le menu n'est pas fixe. J'avais en tête d'acheter le plat les trompettes avec champignons que j'avais vu sur Instagram et j'ai été un peu déçue de voir qu'il n'y était pas! Également, pas beaucoup de choix au niveau des plats de pâtes! Au moins, ce n'est pas trop cher! Ce qui est pratique, c'est qu'il est possible d'acheter des sauces et des pâtes fraîches au comptoir! C'est une bonne place pour dépanner et le service est rapide!

Fresh pasta on the go!   An impromptu stop - I was intrigued to try out this new venue that's only been open for 3 weeks -from the owners of Club Chasse et Pêche, Le Serpent and Le Filet.   I originally wasn't sure if the restaurant took reservations or not- I tried calling the number several times but got no response. I was aware the restaurant closed around 7:00 pm. So, I took a chance and drove there with an hour to spare till closing. No line-ups.  Initially walking in - it felt like a Mandys Salad place vibe. Spacious with a modern look - Dec with aloe Vera plants - there was a fridge carrying pasta, salad, and dessert on the go as well as a display of their own brand of condiments such as YELLOW KETCHUP!! and dry pastas.   The menu was simple and revolves on a weekly basis. All prices were less than 15$ without tax items included a list of antipasti,pasta, oven baked pasta, and a wine list ( glass, carafe, bottle).  Rating out of 5 stars: I ordered the the antipasti - melon, tomato with fresh mozzarella Salad ** (it would've tasted better served cold); two baked dishes that were literally prepared and warmed up - beef cannelloni ***; truffle macaroni ****(highly recommended);Barbaresco 2014 red wine **** (light bodied and fruity notes). All dishes were shared for 2 ppl. There was complimentary bread that was great! But served cold.   Service was friendly, and food was served relatively quickly. Location  is car accessible with paid parking around the area. There were like 8-10 ppl that ordered food on the go within the  45 mins U was  there- it seemed popular with the locals in the area.  It was nice to try this place out- but I didn't find it was a in dining place at all. More food options would've been nice. Worth checking out if you're  hungry and on the go in the area.

J'y suis allée pour la première fois cet après-midi, et ce fut une délicieuse surprise. Il y avait une bonne sélection de plats de pâtes sur l'ardoise, dont de la lasagne et du poulet cacciatore. J'ai entendue dire que le menu changeait chaque semaine.  On se prend un cabaret et on commande au comptoir. Ils viennent nous servir à notre place.  J'ai donc opté pour un spaghetti sauce tomate et burrata. Tout était savoureux. Les pâtes étaient cuites al dente, et la sauce était parfaitement exécutée. L'assiette était joliement dressée et la portion était très adéquate. Avec le pain, j'avais un tentinet trop mangé. J'ai aussi pris une portion de lasagne pour emporter. La plus dé-li-cieuse lasagne que j'ai mangée. Et j'en ai eu amplement pour deux lunchs.  Ils ont aussi un comptoir réfrigéré de produits (sauces, pâtes, pesto etc.) faits sur-place et un présentoir de produits importés comme des pâtes sèches, de l'huile d'olive et des tomates en boite. J'aurais eu le goût de toute goûter.  Le service était impeccable. J'ai finalement trouvé une alternative à mon Euro-déli qui avait dû fermer il y a quelques années. Yay!

I wiped my plate clean!! Yum!  just happened by while hungry in the area. Was drawn in because it looked like quick casual service. Rigatoni with fresh mozzarella, fresh basil, fresh tomatoes and kalamata olives was perfectly al dente and scrumptiously delicious. It was on the tepid side temperature-wise which made it refreshing. Fancy tap water was a nice touch. I'll definitely be back for healthy quality on the quick.

Simply amazing. Delicious homemade pasta with the tastiest of sauces. Friendly, unpretentious and authentic. This place is the real deal! Fresh, made to order restaurant quality, cafeteria style. Leave room for dessert- if you can!

Great quality. Good for takeout or eating at the counter during the work week. Would not recommend coming with large groups. Reasonable pricing!   Main let down for me was that the "oven pasta" dishes were pre-made and sitting in a warmer. Completely understand that this is what needs to be done for time, but definitely affected food quality. Portions are smallish, do not come with your male colleagues expecting heaps of pasta.
